VC1.name: Cluster Autoscaler version matches cluster version
VC1.description: The Cluster Autoscaler's version should match the Kubernetes cluster version for compatibility

AD1.name: Auto Discovery is enabled
AD1.description: Auto Discovery should be enabled unless you have specific advanced use cases

AD2.name: Node groups have proper auto-discovery tags
AD2.description: Node groups must have the required tags for auto-discovery to work

IAM1.name: Least privileged IAM role with scoped permissions
IAM1.description: IAM role should follow least privilege principle with actions scoped to specific Auto Scaling Groups

NG1.name: Identical scheduling properties within node groups
NG1.description: Each node in a node group should have identical scheduling properties (labels, taints, resources)

NG2.name: Prefer fewer node groups with many nodes
NG2.description: Node groups with many nodes are preferred over many node groups with fewer nodes for scalability

NG3.name: Use EKS Managed Node Groups
NG3.description: EKS Managed Node Groups provide automatic discovery and graceful termination features

CO1.name: Use Spot Instances with proper diversification
CO1.description: Spot instances can save up to 90% cost but require proper diversification strategy

CO2.name: Separate On-Demand and Spot capacity
CO2.description: Isolate On-Demand and Spot instances into separate Auto Scaling Groups due to different scheduling properties

CO3.name: Configure appropriate expander strategy
CO3.description: Expander strategy determines which node group to scale for cost optimization

PS1.name: Appropriate resource allocation for Cluster Autoscaler
PS1.description: Cluster Autoscaler needs sufficient CPU and memory resources for large clusters

PS2.name: Optimize scan interval for cluster size
PS2.description: Scan interval should be balanced between responsiveness and API rate limiting

AV1.name: Configure overprovisioning for reduced latency
AV1.description: Overprovisioning trades cost for improved pod scheduling latency

AV2.name: Protect expensive workloads from eviction
AV2.description: Long-running or expensive workloads should be protected from scale-down eviction
